info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 5:46PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Orange and south central Caledonia Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 546 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Newbury, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West Fairlee, Bradford, Vershire, Corinth Corners, Topsham Four Corners, Wells River Village, Thetford Hill State Park, Ryegate, Thetford Center, Corinth, Newbury, Topsham, Strafford, Newbury Village, Thetford, Groton Village, Fairlee, Tunbridge, Groton and Barnet. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 83 and 118. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
